title: Polish President Duda Says De-Escalation Under Way in Russia
description: The situation in Russia appears to be de-escalating, which bodes well for Poland’s security, President Andrzej Duda said.

title: Kremlin Spokesman says Wagner Owner Prigozhin Will Move to Belarus
description: MOSCOW (AP) — Kremlin spokesman says Wagner owner Yevgeny Prigozhin will move to Belarus as part of deal to defuse rebellion tensions.

title: Making Sense of a Chaotic 24 Hours for Putin and Russia
description: It’s been an extraordinary 24 hours in Russia.

title: Germany to Step Up Anti-Aircraft Tanks for Ukraine, Welt Says
description: Germany plans to expand deliveries of Gepard anti-aircraft tanks to Ukraine this year, adding as many as 30 to about 50 that have been delivered or are in the pipeline, Welt am Sonntag quoted a German general as saying.

title: Prigozhin Turns His Forces Back from Moscow, Avoids Showdown
description: Wagner mercenary leader Yevgeny Prigozhin dramatically halted his advance toward Moscow and ordered his fighters to return to their bases, saying he wanted to avoid bloodshed.

title: Russia’s Descent Into Chaos Marks a ‘Good Day’  For Ukraine
description: No matter how Saturday’s struggle for power in Russia unfolds, officials in Kyiv say they’re sure of one thing: it benefits Ukraine.

title: Greeks Vote With Markets Hoping for a New Stable Government
description: Greeks head to the polls on Sunday for the second time in just over a month to decide who’ll govern the country for the next four years, with former Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis the most likely winner, based on May’s vote outcome.

title: Zambia to Pay 1% Interest After ‘Mission Impossible’ Debt Deal
description: Zambia will pay interest rates of as low as 1% until 2037 as part of its debt restructuring deal secured with nations including China this week, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Russia Revolt and Nursing Burnout: Your Saturday US Briefing
description: Something for the weekend.

title: Meloni Says Italian Vote on ESM Reform Would Be Mistake For Now
description: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said she opposes having Italian lawmakers take up a revision of the euro area’s bailout fund, stoking a standoff that puts her country at odds with the European Union.

title: Putin’s Address, Dobbs v. Jackson Anniversary: Social Buzz
description: Welcome to Social Buzz, a daily column looking at what’s trending on social media platforms. I’m Alicia Diaz, a Washington reporter on Bloomberg’s Weekend team. Here’s your daily look at what the internet is talking about.

title: Erdogan Backs Putin as Turkey Offers to Help Russia
description: The Kremlin said Turkish leader Recep Tayyip Erdogan offered his “full support” to President Vladimir Putin for the steps taken by Russian authorities in response to an insurrection by the Wagner mercenary group.

title: UK Pension Reform May Drive Billions to Riskier Assets, FT Says
description: Highly-anticipated reforms of UK pensions could channel billions of pounds into fast-growing companies and boost investments in riskier assets, the Financial Times reported.

title: Nurses Have Had Enough, Threatening Big Gaps in US Health Care
description: A large swath of American nurses want out of the profession, raising the threat of a mass exodus that would leave gaping holes in health care.

title: Putin Slams Russian Mercenary Revolt as ‘Treason’: Weekend Reads
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin accused forces loyal to the Wagner mercenary group that’s fought in his invasion of Ukraine of staging a rebellion that amounted to “treason.”

title: Pakistan to Raise Taxes in Final Attempt to Secure IMF Loan
description: Pakistan will make changes to its budget for the next fiscal year to appease the International Monetary Fund’s concerns on taxes.

title: Sunak May Regret Those Five Pledges: Saturday UK Briefing
description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter.

title: Public Worker Pay Rises May Be Next Victim of Stubborn UK Inflation
description: UK inflation is running so high that the government is considering blocking pay rises for millions of public workers amid concern they could push prices higher, the Times reported.

title: Prigozhin Says Wagner Won’t Surrender After Putin’s Address
description: Wagner paramilitary group won’t surrender to demands from Russian President Vladimir Putin or the security services, Yevgeniy Prigozhin, Wagner’s owner, says in audio message in his Telegram channel.

title: What Is Russia’s Wagner Group and Why Is It Accused of Mutiny?
description: Tension between Yevgeny Prigozhin, head of Russia’s Wagner private militia group, and the nation’s defense establishment exploded in dramatic fashion on Friday. The mercenary chief vowed to punish Russian military leaders, saying Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu had orchestrated a missile attack that killed “huge” numbers of his fighters. The Kremlin responded swiftly, denying the attack and accusing Prigozhin of mutiny.

title: Labour Takes 25-Point Lead Over Tories in New YouGov Poll
description: The UK’s Labour party is extending its lead over the ruling Conservatives, according to a weekly YouGov poll for the Times newspaper.

title: Putin Denounces Wagner ‘Treason,’ Threatens Harsh Response
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin denounced as “treason” a rebellion by forces loyal to the powerful head of the Wagner mercenary group and threatened “harsh” punishment.

title: Ukraine Recap: Russia Strikes Kyiv in Midst of Wagner Turmoil
description: As the Kremlin’s invasion of Ukraine enters its 17th month the drama switched to the home front when tensions between Russia’s military and the Wagner mercenary group boiled over late Friday. President Vladimir Putin is getting round-the-clock updates following an “attempt at an armed mutiny” by Wagner chief Yevgeny Prigozhin, and is expected to address the nation soon. Interfax reported that a “counter-terror regime” has been declared in Moscow and the surrounding region. Prigozhin said his fig

title: Thai Parliament to Convene Session on July 3 Enabling Vote for New Premier
description: Thailand’s newly elected parliament will meet in the first week of July, setting in motion the process of new government formation followed by the vote to elect a prime minister.

title: Raw But Ready to Fight: Ukraine Sends National Guard to Frontline
description: Its counteroffensive struggling, Kyiv turns to National Guard to counter new Russian push in the east.

title: North Korea Criticizes Blinken’s Remarks During His China Visit
description: North Korea criticized US Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s remarks during his trip to China, accusing him of threatening military action should China fail to put pressure on its neighbor and ally.

title: Economic Crisis Clouds Bio’s Reelection Attempt in Sierra Leone
description: Sierra Leone’s leader, Julius Maada Bio, will seek a second five-year term in elections on Saturday as an economic crisis envelops the West African nation.

title: Sunak Risks Failing on His Five Key UK Pledges at Halfway Point
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak risks failing against the very promises he told voters to judge him by.

title: Australia to Spend Millions on Empty Refugee Center, Paper Says
description: Australia will continue funding its controversial offshore detention processing center in Nauru even as the facility’s remaining refugees leave, in an effort to dissuade people-smugglers from sending boats to the country, according to local media.

title: Covid-19 Origins Remain a Mystery, Declassified Report Shows
description: US intelligence agencies weren’t able to determine whether researchers at laboratory in Wuhan, China, who fell sick in the fall of 2019 were infected with Covid-19, which soon spread around the world, according to a declassified report released Friday.

title: Prigozhin, the Mercenary Chief Urging an Uprising, Has Long Ties to Putin
description: Once a low-profile businessman who benefited from having President Vladimir Putin as a powerful patron, Yevgeny Prigozhin moved into the global spotlight with Russia’s war in Ukraine.

title: Argentina Economy Minister Sergio Massa to Run for President
description: Argentina Economy Minister Sergio Massa will run for president as the only candidate of the government’s ruling coalition, according to a message on Twitter.

title: Australia Sanctions Three People for Downing MH17 Over Ukraine
description: Australia placed sanctions on three individuals involved in the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 in 2014, after two were convicted in the Hague late last year for the attack that killed all 298 people on board.
